enttyp.enttypd: An area of land defined by measurement.
enttyp.enttypds: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

attr.attrdef: The lot number is a five character record that describes a parcel of land in conjunction with the plan number. The lot number can be either alpha or numeric and is right justified.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The plan number is a ten character record that describes a parcel of land in conjunction with the lot number. The plan number must begin with an alpha character to a maximum of five with the balance being numeric. The record is left justified.
Accuracy code is an indicator of the source of the captured DCDB data.

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: Open the Queensland Spatial Catalogue (QSpatial). Select the large SEARCH button and all available records are displayed. Select one of the four filter options provided and then the further options within the filter. The resultant search is then displayed. Select your record and complete the order.

distorTran.unitsODist: Whole of dataset, although clipped areas are available through QSpatial.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset is the spatial representation of land parcel boundaries in Queensland, and their related parcel descriptions, as captured in the Digital Cadastre DataBase (DCDB).
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Provides a graphical representation of the land parcel boundaries of Queensland. It is commonly used as a spatial reference for other land parcel related datasets, or to locate individual lots.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: © State of Queensland (Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy) 2020

idPoC.rpOrgName: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

resMaint.maintNote: NOTE: Weekly updates for "whole of state" external download via QSpatial.

contact.rpOrgName: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

LegConsts.useLimit: The State of Queensland (Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy)

Updated data available at http://qldspatial.information.qld.gov.au/catalogue/ .

SecConsts.userNote: Unrestricted to all levels of government and community. Data is available to all government agencies, community groups and individuals. Dataset is available through physical supply and may be made available via web delivery tools, for example, through DNRME's internet sites.
SecConsts.classSys: ISO 19115 (mapped from Qld Govt Information Security Standard IS18)

Consts.useLimit: Not to be used as a definitive absolute location of land parcel boundaries.Refer to the ACC_CODE attribute for the accuracy of land parcels in your area of interest.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: This spatial dataset consists of only current parcels from the source Digital Cadastre DataBase (DCDB) system. It is updated nightly from the DCDB and is available via QSpatial as either a real time extraction for subject areas, or as a weekly packaged "whole of state" dataset. It is a fundamental reference layer for spatial information systems. This spatial dataset is not the point of truth for property boundaries, property descriptions or tenure information within the Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy - other source systems perform this role.

report.measDesc: The capture over the whole of the State is ongoing. The Department's Service Delivery Statement is "90% of cadastral survey plans are entered into the DCDB within 7 days of registration". The easement layer in the digital cadastre does not represent the full set of current easements. When the digital cadastre was created, easements that were shown on current survey plans were included. As new plans are registered, easements that are shown on those plans are included when they appear on the title. However, other easements that have not been surveyed do not appear. Furthermore, the department does not have a process by which the issue, surrenders or partial surrenders of easements are notified to administrators of the digital cadastre. A similar situation exits with covenants, profit a prendres and carbon abatement interest in that the DCDB may not represent a complete dataset due to processes in the titling system and the complexities in the way the interests are recorded. Information about missing easements, encumbrances and interests can be sent to CadastralAdminDataHelp@dnrme.qld.gov.au The land title is the point of truth for easements and other restrictions.

conSpec.resTitle: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy data capture process

ConResult.conExpl: The data is to a standard determined as fit for the purpose for which it was collected.

report.measDesc: The current DCDB can be considered as a seamless map of the State and consists of base cadastral parcels, strata level parcels (secondary interests), volumetric and easement parcels. Base parcels are contiguous with surrounding base parcels. The graphic package and the routines that extract and reload update data to the database have a tolerance of 2mm.

conSpec.resTitle: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy data capture process

ConResult.conExpl: The data is to a standard determined as fit for the purpose for which it was collected.

report.measDesc: Positional accuracy values have been allocated to all parcels in the DCDB and are an attribute of the parcel. This value reflects "maximum error" status of the parcel and has been derived from the capture process or assigned as the DCDB data has been spatially upgraded. This derived DCDB dataset contains a field (ACC_CODE) that includes a text description of positional accuracy for each parcel.

conSpec.resTitle: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy data capture process

ConResult.conExpl: The data is to a standard determined as fit for the purpose for which it was collected.

report.measDesc: At the time of the initial graphical capture, a segment/parcel number was allocated to uniquely describe each parcel of land. Attribute information collected from plans and maps was then linked to the segment/parcel number to form the relationship between the graphics and the attributes. A double entry process of keying in the attributes was done to eliminate any keying in errors. New update plans are committed to the database through a supervisor signoff process. There are several system validation procedures in the maintenance process and these are run at a required frequency. The estimated accuracy of the attribute information is 98%.

conSpec.resTitle: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy data capture process

ConResult.conExpl: The data is to a standard determined as fit for the purpose for which it was collected.

report.measDesc: The estimated accuracy of attribute information is 98% correct exclusive of: - Locality details which are being progressively captured and validated and, - Parish/County details which are not validated or maintained.

conSpec.resTitle: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy data capture process

ConResult.conExpl: The data is to a standard determined as fit for the purpose for which it was collected.

dataLineage.statement: The Land Parcel Boundary dataset was developed by manually digitizing the best available cadastral maps of the time. The initial digital capture was completed to the agreed standard in 1992. Positional accuracy of the Land Parcel Boundary dataset was derived from both the source map scale and the precision of the digitizing. Consequently, this positional accuracy initially varied throughout Queensland. The Land Parcel Boundary dataset is continuously updated by inputting registered cadastral survey plans and other administrative notifications. The Land Parcel Boundary dataset is also being systematically upgraded to improve the spatial accuracy. The current datum of the Parcel Boundary dataset is GDA94. Construction lines in the Land Parcel Boundary dataset are not warranted to be actual boundaries of any feature. This dataset is created and updated by an automated application process that replaces the Land Parcel Boundary layer nightly.

prcStep.stepDesc: The spatial representation of the parcel boundaries are updated by an automatic routine that replaces the data every night. No visual inspection or manual intervention points are applied. Various integrity checks such as expected counts are applied by the automatic process.

dataSource.srcDesc: This dataset is a spatial representation of parcel boundaries sourced from the DCDB system.
